UniProt Entry.description: The amino acid sequence of the current peptide coincides with the part of the UniProt entry that represents a peptide precursor.

Literature.Title: Segment-Based Peptide Design Reveals the Importance of N-Terminal High Cationicity for Antimicrobial Activity Against Gram-Negative Pathogens
Literature.Author: Mechesso AF, Zhang W, Su Y, Xie J, Wang G

Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: Human erythrocytes:10% Hemolysis=<8 µM,Human erythrocytes:50% Hemolysis=30 µM
Sequence Information.Target Organism: Staphylococcus aureus USA 300 LAC(MIC=1µM),Staphylococcus epidermidis 1457(MIC=2µM),Escherichia coli E423-17(MIC=2µM),Pseudomonas aeruginosa E411-17(MIC=2µM),Klebsiella pneumoniae E406-17(MIC=2µM),Acinetobacter baumannii B28-16(MIC=2µM)
